citations.narrative:
The licensee has not developed a written contingency plan for the facility. The lack of an adequate contingency plan could
increase the risk of not being able to safeguard animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop,
document and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care
of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site.
The plan must address all the components of section 2.134. Correct by January 29, 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
There was no written and documented program for the environmental enrichment of the individually housed spider
monkey at the facility. Failure to develop a written environmental enhancement plan can lead to boredom, stress,
behavioral issues, and self-injurious behaviors, particularly for individually housed nonhuman primates. The licensee must
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the
psychological well-being of nonhuman primates. The plan must be in accordance with the currently accepted professional
standards and must address all points in section 3.81. Correct by January 29, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
